Description: Upper body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; on left, part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; below, white band; exterior: part of maeander pattern running left above three lines; below, painted decoration consisting of top of rump of goat to right with its head turned to left; pendant roundel, dotted circle and dot rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as produced by the Painter of the Aphrodite Bowl because the decorative style is similar to the style on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 73-4). The sherd ought to belong to the later period of the Wild Goat Style since the pattern decoration on the exterior surface is typical of the Wild Goat Style, but the lotus decoration on the interior, which is absent during this period, is typical in the later reserved Animal Chalice, Grand and Chalice styles.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 22)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 74, p. 240, no. 211, pl. 16)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 127, p. 132, note 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0401) (phase 2)
